lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey, everyone. Sorry about that little issue there. But thank you for your patience. I appreciate that. Going back over what had transpired previously. So the party was hired to go into Kraghammer seeking Lady Kima of Vord, who is a renowned folk hero, a halfling paladin of much renown, following Bahamut, the Platinum Dragon of justice and good, who went on a vision quest, apparently seeing some sort of evil brewing beneath Kraghammer, and went on her own to seek it and destroy it. Hasn't been seen for many weeks-- months, even -- since. And so the party has then gone into Kraghammer to attempt to locate her. After some conversing, some brawling, some interesting circumstances, they found information that she disappeared into the Mithril mines just underneath the lower circle of Kraghammer. They've since battled a few creatures, apparently these strange monstrosities are coming out of the mines recently. And they've had dwarven miners being taken and disappearing. They charged into the mines, found one of the series of tunnels that had broken into the mines from some other source, encountered a few umber hulks, were ambushed by some duergar, which are subterranean, dark, ashen grey--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- messed-up dwarves and an intellect devourer, which proceeded to blast Grog, reduce his intelligence to zero, and leave him catatonic and brain-dead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where we left off. But we'll pick up that in a second. Let's go ahead and continue our introductions. We had Taliesin, now we have Marisha--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I am the Circle of the Moon druid. Level nine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi! Oh, my brother is extra, extra stealth right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I play Vex'ahlia, who is a half-elf ranger, and I have an amazing--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -- companion bear named Trinket, who is basically the coolest ever. And he's good at everything he does. I'm okay. But he's excellent.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm Grog Strongjaw. I'm a goliath barbarian, level nine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, I didn't say that. Level nine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have an intelligence of six normally, but now it's negative two.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And my brain is made of applesauce.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Liam, who is not here yet, but will be here shortly but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And when he returns we'll get to his introduction as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And Ashley Johnson, who has missed the last couple of games because she's been filming, when she returns will be playing Pike.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're just introducing ourselves, that's all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Exactly! It's okay, we've had technical difficulties, so.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh, hey, he made the introductions, folks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, hi, Mark, welcome to the game.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Liam, if you remember any characters you voiced in it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We're scattered throughout the game so just-- If you can't get enough of us here, you'll be really hating our voices by playing through that. And then also, Orion--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And Matthew Mercer plays Trey in it as well.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Seven does maybe eat nine. Who knows?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And as a fan, I'm excited, so check it out, too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's legit awesome. So a lot of cool, exciting things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, this one's in Tales from the Borderlands being awesome.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three. Three nights. Three nights sold out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So, last we left off, in a subterranean cavern with a deep underground river flowing through it. Pitch darkness. You managed to survive a conflict with two umber hulks, thanks to Polymorph and some good tactics. However, Grog then charged headlong towards a light source-- turned out to be a campfire across the way-- where he walked into an ambush by a few duergar which began shooting him with crossbow bolts. And an intellect devourer made him brain-dead. You guys--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's got nobody to blame but himself.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. We're beginning now as Grog has collapsed, face down on the ground, drooling.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The last of the duergar have been blown off the cliff or destroyed. You all rush in, and find Grog not moving, not responding, not anything.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Grog! Grog, can you hear us?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you feel us near you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -- and slap him on the face a few times.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Someone, quick! Draw a dick on his face!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to actually try a crude medical examination to see if I can--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A thorough goliath cavity search later--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You find some stray gold pieces.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's a very deep belly button you have there, my god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The goliath physicality's a little difficult.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking over him, and there's very little physical damage to him. He shrugs it off pretty easily. There's no notable sign or anything other than the fact that his eyes aren't reacting to anything. It looks like he is catatonic.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No bleeding from the ear? No bleeding from the nose?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to go take a look at the remnants of the brain creature.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The whole texture seems very slimy and rubbery.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it's much larger than any natural brain should be. It's probably-- When it was all in one piece, it would have been roughly about the size of a small dog.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do any of us know anything about magic that could heal him? Like any spells.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's clear that when that brain thing hit Grog with his zapper thing, that it rendered him unconscious. I would assume that it is a magical creature, just based on the attack alone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He got zapped and now he's unconscious.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A shorter way of saying the same thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should try-- Does anybody have any healing? I know Pike isn't here, but--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'd have to take a break. I'd have to pull out my books and relearn it. It takes some time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How much time do you need?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! It's another-- What is it? An ass cloud? Is that what it was?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How many entrances-- How many ways or edges where we are? Because it's like at the center, anyway--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're currently basically on the precipice of a large cavern that has multiple layers as the river kind of cascades off into multiple waterfalls. As far as you can see-- which isn't far good because there's no other light source beyond you guys-- the cavern just continues indefinitely for a good 60 feet and then just vanishes into darkness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, maybe we should sleep. Try to camp for the time--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we'll need to form a perimeter and someone will have to stand guard--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, currently you're holding a barely alive duergar hostage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Oh! Right! I forgot about that!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And I can speak its language.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: First thing you note, too: it is female, and it takes a moment to register that because she is also bald on top.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Teeth are kind of yellow and gnarled and sharp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How close to death's door is she?

lines.name: CREW
lines.text: There's more coming, this is the vegan pizza.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Chat room? Chat room bought us a pizza?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are awesome! Thank you so much!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Vegan pizza? Are you kidding me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look at those chocolate cakes! Oh.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think we need to heal her just enough--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not so fast, not so fast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll heal her after she talks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't you make that bargain then--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've got dagger to her throat and I'm hold-- She's bald?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, so I've got an arm around the top of her forehead in--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't kill her. I need her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's got a huge shoulder wound.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, I call my sister over. I'll hold her, you talk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you do to our friend?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I didn't do anything. That was the brain's work." (chuckles)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did the brain work do to our friend?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How do we-- (lowers voice) How do we fix it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I press the blade a little tighter.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dig in. Maybe one hit point worth of--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, no! She's only got one hit point left.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's more than one way to make someone talk!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to shoot my gun off-- get it nice and hot right at the tip and start cauterizing the wounds.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The sound of blast echoes throughout the entirety of the cavern. You can hear (echoing gunshot) cascade off.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He takes the barrel, slams it into the shoulder and the sizzling sound as she reaches back in pain. Make an intimidation check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21? All right. She's now, like, breathing heavy.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm using my Mage Hand to poke her in the face.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Look, we haven't got all day. How do we fix it--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And who do you work for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You shall all be harvested for K'varn!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can't understand her. Only she can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who is K'varn? Does anybody know?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, is that a thing? Is that a person?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know. I don't know. I've got--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I roll history on that or is that--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can roll history, if you like.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The one who guides us to take the surface back!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A 14 in history wouldn't do anything?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is K'varn the one making creepy zombie monsters?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "K'varn likes to tinker with the fleshlings, yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where is K'varn located? Point the direction.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks over her shoulder back towards the darker part of the cavern where you guys haven't traversed. "Deep. Deep."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I slap her across the face.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lightly! Not enough to make her lose a hit point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like a Three Stooges act.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm just relishing your faces, for they will be gnarled and twisted soon enough!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Break her legs. Leave her here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Heal her. Maybe we should heal her--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And let her lay there. Is that evil? That's pretty evil.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait! Ask her if she's seen Nostoc. Or if they've seen--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Or, yeah, if they've seen our paladin friend. Our little--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Before we end your life, tell us, have you seen a small halfling?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see a moment of recognition in the female duergar's face, and it's-- "There was a halfling, aye. She was foolish enough to come down here alone. She's dead now."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We've taken her life and it was delicious."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I drag her to her feet. Walk her over to the edge of the cliff where the water is, and hold her. Knife still at her neck. Tell this one: Now's her last chance to give us anything useful to lead to her boss, I guess.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't, and we'll make you suffer.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right. Ooh, my new dice! Ooh! C'mon, baby!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to assist her by taking my other dagger and letting it drip poison down the blade.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. Okay, go ahead and roll again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm giving you the advantage on the roll because he has a blade to her now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She laughs and says: "Your friend's dead! All is lost! You came for nothing!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I tell if she's lying? Is it--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, can I see if she's lying?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can also make an insight check as well.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can't understand what the-- What the hell's she saying?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. She is definitively lying through her teeth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! We know you're lying! (all laugh)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes! I don't know what else to ask her, guys. I don't know what else to ask her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She looks at you for a second, goes, "Regardless, we have her. She's down below. And, soon enough, "you'll see. You'll see what shall become of this halfling."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We'll rescue her! And we're going to kill your god! (all laugh)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did it, I did it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The most awkward throat-slitting I've ever heard of.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We're going to kill your god. Wait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the body goes limp in your hands, you kinda let it tumble over the waterfall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Um, now you guys are standing over Grog in this kind of makeshift--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- camp site. The embers of the fire kinda going low.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we keep-- I'm going to keep watch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have any idea what time it is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point? It's at some point in the evening.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go to the next cavern over to where we killed those umber hulks?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Take one of the umber hulk heads and put it on a stick.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Right out front of where we're-- Of where we're camping as sort of a warning to others.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How many cavern entrances are there from where we're camping?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From where you are? (creepy music sound effect)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are where you came in through--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's the entrance you came in. Across the way, there appears to be another cavern that you can kinda see the entrance to. Those are the only proper openings into this giant chamber. Otherwise there's just the giant, over-arching cave that you guys are just getting into. Just pushing through, so--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm gonna take the first watch--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I still have a lot of reading to do, and I can go ahead-- I'm gonna go ahead and cast-- Make sure everybody's in! Everybody's in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, wait! I want to check the bodies of the other guys before the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are you casting? What are you about to cast?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make an investigative check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A shell that keeps in anything from coming in.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Great. Well, before you do that, hold on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Glancing about, you pull roughly 125 gold pieces between the three corpses of the duergar. Well, two corpses because one of them is gone. It washed downstream.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She had all the good things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She had a lot of good stuff on her.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You do, however, find on one of them a gnarled implement of some kind, whether it be scavenged or not. It's of a strange, like almost bleached bone ivory that comes to a point at one end.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, let me see, let me see.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: An artifact we can bring back to--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I take a look at it and--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give it to Tiberius. He'll try anything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Scanlan, it is a very pretty something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 24. Want to hand it over to him?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Wonderful, this is. Wonderful. Magic Missiles, of course.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: This one has seven charges. While holding it, you, you can use an action to expend one or more of its charges to cast the Magic Missile spell from it. For one charge, you cast the first-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot by one for each level by each additional charge you expend. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a d20. On a one, the wand crumples into ashes and then--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Basically it shoots out six missiles and then it--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm glad we killed them before they used that on us.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We should probably get Keyleth on the books.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Take a nap so that, maybe--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Make sure everyone's in and close by, and get done with everything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Keyleth, you need to study, so we'll take first watch.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's true, you should study while we watch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm gonna cast Anti-Life Shell. That way everyone at least gets one good hour of sleep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right, let's take a nap.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You go ahead and you eventually find one of the corpses of the umber hulk. It takes you a good 25 minutes to eventually carve through its relatively thick hide, chitinous exterior. You put the head on a makeshift spike, and it is now there on display.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, as a warning to others.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- as you are taking first watch, you notice that the campsite that the duergar were using, where you guys are currently resting for the evening, it's been there for a while and it looks like the duergar have repurposed it. The fire-- the stones that were set up around the actual fire pit have probably been there for quite some time, and were set up very uniformly and very well placed. Right above you, on one of the stone walls, you see what appears to be a strange, very well carved symbol. Hard to recognize it. Go ahead and make a religion check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, we wish Pike was here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just a really interesting carving on the wall just right above where you guys are currently residing--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not quite catching your attention, but it seems to have some significance. And it's fresh, it's not like an ancient symbol that's been there, it maybe could have been there for more than a week or two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go ahead and I take a piece of paper from my spellbook, and I take a piece of charcoal, and I just scroll over top of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: To get an imprint of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, it's very big. It's like four feet by three feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I take a few pieces of paper, and I kind of glue them together- (all laugh)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: -- and then I get a really big one, and then I roll it up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. All right, you guys begin to set up for the next watch. After the first hour--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I have my Anti-Life Shell up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, Anti-Life Shell eventually fades, first hour without any impact or issue.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Who is taking the next watch?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. The next few hours go by without incident.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's nice. Can I look around and see-- I mean, no! In our area! I'm not gonna wander off, but just to see if I see any kind of anything interesting. I mean, if this is a really old area that I've noticed, it's old, can I see anything cool and old around us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You also catch the strange carved symbol right atop your guys' camp.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. So I tap my brother and go, look at this. Do you know anything about religion?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, me too! I know shit about it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I really wish Pike was here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just, the party is taking turns being like, so pretty!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's on one of the large cave surfaces near where you guys are camping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't see any cool sparkly things in the mineral deposits? None of that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How's it going over there, Grog?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You finish your watch without issue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Next up watch, this is the last, third, and final watch you guys are now going through.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll come with Tiberius as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After they're napping. Occasionally you have to adjust Grog, 'cause you're not sure if he's still breathing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not sure if he's still breathing?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm gonna do an intelligence, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, what if you could die while we're sleeping?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You are familiar with this symbol specifically because of your background. That is the symbol of Bahamut. It is the symbol of the Platinum Dragon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And you ascertain it was probably--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And it was probably used as part of some sort of a protection ritual.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was the name of the bad guy that she said?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I tell everybody that. Well, that I'm with.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm gonna guess that's how you spell it.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It seems it's a protective symbol of sorts, but it's of Bahamut, which is a good thing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: K'vah? I thought it was K'varn.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Bahamut is the essentially nicer deity of the two between him and Tiamat, which is a total asshole, but--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well that must be why Lady Kima came down here.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Right. So she must have camped here, put this symbol up for protection.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you are having this discussion, you feel a slight rumble in the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some of the rocks nearby, the loose pebbles, begin to vibrate and move around.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: No, I don't think-- I think we should alert the others.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're waking up, we're waking up. Don't worry, we are gonna heal you.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: How far are we from everybody? We're just like--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys are all clustered in the small camp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's quietly wake them, and I will go peer into the darkness and see if I can see them.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Rumbling is never a good thing, Scanlan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Something's rumbling? I wasn't paying attention.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Do you still have your light source up, Light, or you just, the campfire?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you are-- outside of just, maybe 15, 20 feet, you see nothing. It's pitch black.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's wake everybody up, and then we'll get to work--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: -- on Grog, and go see what that is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is all this going at the same time?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the rumbling continuous, or is it just one little rumble?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A few moments pass, the rumbling has subsided.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's heal this guy. Can you heal him?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Am I awake? Are we awake? Did you wake me up?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I do Prestidigitation and wake everybody up--

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: -- with a little spritz of water in the face.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like the flower, the flower trick?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why water? Why would you do that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why couldn't you just touch me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ah, that was a good nap!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I do it again, and clean everybody up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How is everyone feeling? Do we need to heal? Everyone?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to heal this guy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, what about us? How are we feeling?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we all just slept, so we're fine.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You've all slept for the evening--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: --and from the points of your unused--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, just wait a little bit longer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- healing dice, you're pretty much all at max health, so.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, do we wanna stay here? Do we wanna do this here?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: There was a rumble. Okay, we need to get Grog, the others, and--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long will this take, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tiberius-- I don't know. But I want us to be as safe as we can. Tiberius, can you lift us up on your pillars, or like, encase us in, or something? Make us a room?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I was just about to do that!

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: But everybody hates when I do that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you gonna cast a spell now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I'd like to give her a little inspirational song.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan, give me some nice meditation, some--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Some, like, pure moods. Yes! Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket gives her a massage beforehand to loosen her up.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (sings) You know you got to cure Grog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go ahead and light some incense.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan. Scanlan, do you still have that deity, that little idol of Pike?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do have my idol of Pike, yes!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we just have that out just so I have her energy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just feel like I need her.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I take out the idol of Pike that I keep always close to my loins, and I hold it tightly, and warmly--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you guys-- (all laugh)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Did you want my hand or the statue?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You take a bit of earth from a pouch that you keep of your--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- home tribe where you grew up. You scattered some of it around Grog, who is now laid on his back, whose arms and legs, all equally stretched out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's not go there. No need to be naked.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As this is the first time you've attempted a magic of this type, you close your eyes and take in the earth's essence. As a druid, being connected to nature is where you draw your divine energy. You kind of--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- almost take from the vibration of the nearby caverns that you felt, and come in tune with the way the earth, the planet itself shifts and moves, you--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You got this, Keyleth! You got this!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can do this Keyleth! You can do this!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You use that to give constitutional strength to the physical form of Grog in hopes of restoring him.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I just kind of lay my hands on his forehead.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, I know Grog very well, and he might enjoy, or be inspired by, a kiss of a female. I'm just saying, just the gentle kiss of a female lips on his might rouse him.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You should plant one on him.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vex? Get in there! Get in there! (all laugh)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As Vex awkwardly fumbles over the--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I get an inspiration die from him or anything?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. What am I rolling? What do I do?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a d20, add your wisdom modifier.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I get to assist since I gave him a kiss?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No assistance on this. This only affects a d20 roll.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What'd you roll? What'd you roll?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Where's the inspiration die? Where's the inspiration die?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Didn't you get advantage on that?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do I get advantage on this, since I'm taking time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As is, yes, yeah, you have advantage on the roll, yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on, Keyleth! Keyleth, Keyleth, Keyleth!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm still gonna do the inspiration dice, just in casies. Okay, that's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a brief glow of all the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The dirt that you'd scattered around Grog, and you can see his form kind of take in a deeper breath. His chest expands, and as it does, his eyes, which currently stare off in space, begin to clarify and crystallize and his brow quivers for a second, and you see a little bit of life return to his face.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Why did you run out and destroy nothing? Look what you did. You were giving me crap about the lightning. Don't ever do that again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry, who woke me up from my sleep? (electronic beep)

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It was a group effort really, but Keyleth did an amazing job.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Keyleth? I run over and I give Keyleth a big ol' bear hug, squeezing maybe a bit too tight.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think he shit himself while he was unconscious, so that's gotta smell really wonderful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I smell better than I ever have before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just glad you're all right, Grog. Really glad you're awake.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I reach into the bag of holding and I get the cask of ale and my goblet, and I pour a little goblet of ale and I give it to Keyleth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a note too, just so you guys are aware, 20 is the stat cap for normal physical stats, however magical items can then bump that up higher. Just answering a chat room question.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't even know what that means. Question or the answer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. Don't worry about it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey. How is he doing, how is he feeling?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm so glad you had advantage on that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: My intelligence is-- What is it now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: At like the gym and you need some alcohol, after that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I feel right as rain. What are we killing? (all laugh)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good, he's back, you guys. He's back.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I saunter over to Keyleth. That was mighty impressive.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I had Pike in mind. I channeled her energy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's true, it was quite astounding. I have a little chub on.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) So do I, for some reason.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah well, that's a bit of a side effect.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's part of the Greater Restoration, a few things get restored.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you remember anything about a kiss in your dreams while you were asleep?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, my cheeks are sort of sore for some reason, as if they've been slapped repeatedly by a bunch of twats, and then I've got this one little wet mark right here where I got a kiss and it smells like half-elvish spit.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gave you a kiss and helped wake you up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, why didn't I have Trinket--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Comes over and nuzzles up against you for a moment.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we go kill something now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well shit, I guess we should. I think we are all healed up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did he heal while he was unconscious?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did not get an opportunity to use any of your stuff, so you're currently still at the hit points you were, plus you naturally healed just from the evening's rest.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do some Grog healing. You don't have your healing dice, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm gonna sing a song of rest for you, so that'll add 1d6 to your healing rolls.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How many d12s do you get to roll? You can roll four of them if you need to.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can roll up to nine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You can roll up to nine dice.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Whatever your level is, that's how many dice you can use.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But that's for the day. Once you've used those nine hit dice to heal yourself naturally, you are maxed out outside of magical healing or potions.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I have a feeling these tunnels are going to suck majorly, but we have nowhere to go but down, so--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So we know which tunnel she pointed towards?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She pointed towards the rest of the cavern, which you have just stepped into.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I use tracking and see if I can not only see where the majority of tracks lead to, but see if I can spot the halfling Kima's tracks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lady Kima. Go ahead and make a survival check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which you have advantage on simply for tracking depending on what you're tracking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: My favored enemies are dragons and demons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you would not have advantage on this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's okay. What did you roll?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, but I do. Wait. My favored terrain is the Underdark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right. For that, I will go ahead and give you advantage on that. This is technically considered the crust of the Underdark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That doesn't count if it rolls onto a phone?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think that's in this book.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, I think it's chapter four.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you using for a light source, by the way?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The cavern comes alive with bright white light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You begin to step into the outskirts about 60 feet ahead of what looks like a series of huts, small stone structures cobbled together with small stone and stacked on each other. Simple driftwood and broken pieces of scavenged material put into small buildings. It's a very kinda ramshackle village underground.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am stealthing. I roll stealth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay, I'm gonna stealth too.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Natural 20. Oh, that really didn't count.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just roll on your phone a couple times and then off to the side.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And you said that the red crystals on the wall are glowing somewhat?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's a certain amount of crystal that this mountain range seems to naturally produce that just inherently.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Enough to give the half-elves vision in low light?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It seems such. At the point where you're close to it. Currently you have to use his light source to see much of anything. This village doesn't have any, but near the walls and the edges of the cavern you can see the gentle outline of this whole size of it. It's immense.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it seem that there are signs of life?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this view, you don't see any movement.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I am starting to creep along the ground towards the nearest building and press up against the wall and see if I can-- I'm just going to listen.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled a 16, is that enough to actually stealth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to let the twins stealth ahead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys stealth ahead. The two of you follow each other, and you get to the outskirts, and you can now see in the center of this, a number of the buildings and huts have been smashed or destroyed. You can see more and more of these goblin corpses strewn across the ground. You can see some of these tents seem to have rags or something stuffed into one that's not too far ahead of you. There's two goblins near you, apparently slashed open. Similar wounds. It's just from the first glance stepping forward.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: None of them alive, that we can tell?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We can't see any movement anywhere?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not from this perspective. You guys moved ahead and you barely have any light source of your own. You're having to deal with just the outskirts of his light spell.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And none of that red light is lighting any of this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not in the center of the village. Those are only towards the outside walls of the cavern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can I go up and see if I can get one of those little red rocks?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can walk off to the side. So you take a few minutes to walk off to the very edge of the cavern. The rock is less of an actual stone that you can pull, more than it's a cluster of-- almost like a vein of the stone in the actual wall. It would take a while for you to actually hack it out of the side. It can be done, but it will take you a while.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nah. I don't want to waste the time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you think, should I do it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But we're in pitch black here, and we can't really see what's going on. I think we need--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Wait, hold on. Tiberius, will you bring the party up?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: Oh yes, of course, we'll be right there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Does anybody know-- have we told anybody at home what that actually is?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so as you guys are aware, one of the magical items that was designed by Tiberius early in the campaign are essentially these gem enchanted earrings that activate as a Message spell between a few party members. He made a few of them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was five total. Why don't we nail down who that is. It's the twins.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You have one. He has one. She has one.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we can send and receive messages or just receive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're essentially whispering into each other's ears.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it only works within a certain range.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is it like a Madonna microphone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A straight up with a big ol'--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 500 feet is the maximum length. So. You guys approach slowly, the light source opens up, and you see now a multitude of goblin bodies strewn about the open area of this village. You can see there are actually piles of corpses stuffed into some of these huts in the sides that aren't goblin. You can see what looks like a few small dwarven bodies piled up on the side. As you kinda glance over you look, some of them are partially eaten like they have been stripped for meat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you look through the building, there are piles of bone, sinew, and metal at this point. The dwarven bodies are mostly decomposed entirely, what remnants have not been stripped off it for food.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As far as what you guys can tell, you discover two things. One of the dwarves has a set of very very finely crafted leather armor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: To pull it off the corpse is going to destroy it and going to be a not very interesting affair.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it does look to have survived the horrible conditions under here. You also note specifically, Vex, that not the dwarven corpses, but a number of the goblin corpses you come across, some of them have a uniform wound. A number of these goblin corpses have this terrible puncture wound in the skull.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In the forehead there. Just an opening wound about that big around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You didn't notice that, that's how unperceptive you are.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And for each one of these wounds-- for as much flesh is on these goblins, there doesn't appear to be anything inside.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It sucked their brains out. Whatever it was.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I know what that feels like.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, you're not, you're still hanging out--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you put your finger in the hole?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to put my finger in the hole.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: You guys are sticking to the darkness?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are elements of brain matter within there but even that has become very gelatinous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Partially decomposed in its own right, almost like a slime. But sure enough, the inside of the cranium itself is mostly vacant.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Lovely. Trinket, no, he's not with us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Trinket is back with the party.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we can only assume that, what was his name?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess it seems like it's safe enough, right? Around here right now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As silently as possible, you come running up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Brain suckers, something that sucks brains.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: As long as they are sucking it out of goblins, I'm good with that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: My sister doesn't remember, but one of our instructors in Syngorn used to tell us of a creature, I'm not sure what they're called, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think I was in that class, actually.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mm. A creature that steals its victims' minds and digests them, reaches right in and takes them out.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: I'm assuming it's got to be a much smaller, mutated version of our brain-on-legs friend.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think the brain was a scout or some sort of pet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, we also have this K'varn, who is experimenting on all those creatures, so we can't even attest for any of this.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I take a few steps back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It could just be parts of one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, parts of one. It could be a hodge-podge of everything

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What was that symbol anyway, Tiberius?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: That was a symbol of Bahamut, and it was a protection thing that I'm sure she put up to protect herself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh. So it was a good symbol?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You recall that Lady Kima was, specifically, a paladin of Bahamut.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! So she probably did that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That camp seems to have been hers while she was traipsing through the tunnels.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Our teachers spoke about this thing, said that it was a being of the mind. I think our trouble with Grog could just be the beginning. We need to proceed very carefully.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have two potions of fox's cunning. Could I drink one of those, since there's a giant brain-bitch wondering around the camp?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But it don't last very long.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fox's cunning would give you benefit, I believe, to--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It would be Enhance Ability, essentially.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It would be Enhance Ability for wisdom, I'm pretty sure.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll tell you. I think it's wisdom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's intelligence? Okay, there you go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because I think it's like owl's wisdom for wisdom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, no, you're correct. So essentially it would be an Enhance Ability for intelligence, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, for the potion's effect? That would be anywhere from four to eight hours, you're not quite sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe you should wait until we come across something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right, but if it's too late--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, you have advantage on intelligence checks.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just don't go running off into the dark again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, let us lead the way, or whoever's smart. I'm really smart, how smart are you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It wouldn't make my intelligence higher?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It wouldn't make your intelligence higher, and it wouldn't necessarily help with your vulnerability.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Who's our smartest person? Who has the highest intelligence here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are these scores you keep talking about? I don't know what anybody's talking about.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's okay, Vax. I don't know what a lot of people are talking about all of the time.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, whoever's the smartest should be in the front.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well it's about, like, having high-- it's not necessarily being smart, it's about having resistance to willpower.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But if they take you down-- if they take down your intelligence, then whoever has higher intelligence--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No one's going to take down our intelligence, we're too strong and we're too awesome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want another catatonic-- all right.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: And we know what we're going into.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, we sort of know what we're going into.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does that mean we get to run into a fight?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, this music sounds very fighty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we've already fought two things where we can't look at them and they mess with our heads.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So is there something we can do going forward--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To like boost our willpower or something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You want Magneto's helmet? What you want is Magneto's helmet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I like Magneto's helmet! Or even if we--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we have a bunch of mirrors? Or where we can look through things with reflections.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) I gave you some mirrors! Do you remember?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We do have a big dressing mirror.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know if that's going to help.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, I have them, of course. I always, I always have them, they were a gift.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have one mirror in the bag of holding.

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: With like an ice-type of thing--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kind of like a Medusa's gaze thing. You know, where you like look in the reflection.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: But that's a Gorgon. That's talking about the gaze--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're talking about the mind, I think.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It would just be about making us less vulnerable to the mind--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could you forge some professor hats for us all? (all laugh)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So what, our option is to keep moving forward, then?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, just be cautious, that's all we can do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you want to do, you want go back?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As quietly as possible, to keep moving forward.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's difficult to prepare for what we're not prepared for.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And on the lookout for anything in this ramshackle town.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I can cast Enhance Ability to help our willpower? Or our will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you leave behind the pile of dwarven corpses, you leave behind the goblin corpses with the wounds and start seeing more of a pattern.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And if I may, I suggest Tiberius, you work your Light spell, and Vex'ahlia and I scout ahead about 60 or 70 feet, so that we can see in the dim light, catch anything coming, using your magic.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And I light up the hooded lantern we have in the bag of holding.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So you put the hood on and light that up, very good. Leaving the leather armor behind?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh well, I thought you said it would get ruined if we took it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it would be nasty pulling it off a corpse.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, well then, fuck it, let's pull it off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Isn't it dwarf-sized? Or is armor also shrink and expand?

lines.name: ORION
lines.text: It's fine. I cast Prestidigitation and clean it all up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you shake off the element--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: -- the remaining elements of the dwarven corpse. Just falls off out of the armor. You have to kind of shake it and eventually all of it escapes--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an arcana check. It does have a magical aura.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. It appears to be a simple but powerful enchantment. It is a pair of studded leather armor with a +2 enchantment.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If I try to pull on the sleeve, does it come up to my elbow or does it stretch out and fit?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It comes up to your elbow and then, given a moment, it fits to your form.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go take that studded leather armor, brother!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'll take this, hold on. Thank you. I go into the smelly corpse hut and start to change my armor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What did you get? Let me see that.

lines.name: SAM

The dwarves look very broken and unhappy with the circumstance, but brimming with anger. They're brought through some of the alleys and paths between these pup tents and these stone structures. You can see, there are some of the hulking figures, there are two trolls wandering amongst these duergar.

You look over again, to the camp, and you can now see, toward the very back end of this open midsection, by this platform, there is one large, stone construct. It looks like a makeshift barracks has been placed there, with double stone doors that are currently opened, and you can see two figures stepping out of the stairs that lead into these barracks, heading towards the main platform. They step up onto the platform. One of which is a very, very well-decorated duergar, who's wearing similar blackened plate armor as the other kind of elite guard that you saw surrounding this platform, but with gold and silver scrolling on it, a long, tattered, dark, dark purple cape, and has a nasty scar across the cheek that leads into this kind of gnarled, grey beard. As it steps forward, you can see, sheathed off to its back in a large scabbard, a gargantuan-- for a dwarf especially-- two-handed sword that should be unwieldy for a creature of its size. But nevertheless looks dangerous and a creature next to it is--

Actually, very tall, lanky, long, black and purple robes, a hood, obscuring its features, stepping roughly two feet behind it as they both step on to the platform to address the rest of the guard and the approaching party of duergar dwarves you've been following. You can see some conversation happening, but you're too far away to really make out anything that's being said, do you want to move closer?

At which point, the tentacles unravel from its head, the creature pulls back, a bit of ichor and dwarf blood dripping from what looks like a lamprey's toothy maw, and then thrusts the body to the ground, with a thud as it falls lifeless to the ground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A horrible, bored hole in its forehead. The creature then draws its hood back up, releases its hand in a cursory fashion, and all the duergar whip back around and continue the motions they were previously going towards. As the two dwarven captives that now remain look completely stunned, their faces white with fear as they are being dragged off in this state. The tall, lanky figure gives a nod to the duergar general, who gives a nod as well, then to turn around and walk back.

You step out a few more feet, and you can see the edge of the bridge where the rest of you have finally come to converge on the other side of the crevasse.

Left brainless and dead on the platform in the center, outside of a giant barracks-type building. You reconvened and expressed all of this information to the party.
